translations: <正式>使……突然降临，加速（坏事的发生）；使突然陷入（某种状态）（precipitate sb./sth. into）；（使）沉淀，（使）淀析；<正式>使急落直下，使陡然下落；降水（如雨、雪、冰雹）
<正式>鲁莽的，仓促的（=precipitous）；（事件，情况）突如其来的，突然的；猛地落下的

sentences.sentence: I don't think we should make precipitate decisions.
sentences.translation: 我认为我们不应该做出仓促的决定。

sentences.sentence: A decrease in face-to-face social contact can precipitate depression.
sentences.translation: 面对面社交接触的减少会导致抑郁。

sentences.sentence: It would only serve to precipitate his ruin.
